New Records: England's highest opening stand in T20 cricket
The highest-ever partnership in T20 World Cups
Key Match Events: Alex Hales blasted 86 not out from 47 balls
Jos Buttler scored 80 not out from 49 balls
Hales and Buttler put on a century stand from just 10.1 overs
Virat Kohli made his fourth half-century from six knocks in the tournament
Hardik Pandya smacked five sixes and Virat Kohli made four fours
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler said England wanted to go hard and that Adil Rashid was down to bat 11
Jos Buttler credits England's replacements, particularly Chris Jordan
Rohit Sharma said India were aware that the runs would be scored square, but they could not stop them
Alex Hales said the Adelaide Oval is one of the best grounds to bat at in the world, especially in the power plays
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Adelaide Oval in front of a 40,094-strong crowd
England's win sets up a repeat of the 1992 World Cup final against Pakistan at the MCG
India's massive support was silenced early and was never a factor to be honest
